intro: Kibara cuspidata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clusters of small, colorful blooms. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Kibara cuspidata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
